data.title: Motor City Comic Con
data.text:
Karan Ashley

Known For

Mighty Morphin Power Rangers

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: 60 |

Photo Op: 80 |

Selfie: $60 |

Autograph/Selfie Combo: $100

Karan Ashley was born in Odessa, Texas. She is of mixed African-American and Mexican descent. She had been accepted to North Texas State University, but just before the first day of her freshman year, she landed the role of Aisha Campbell, the second Yellow Ranger in the series Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, replacing the late Thuy Trang (Trini Kwan). In 2023, Ashley reprised the role of Aisha Campbell in the Netflix special, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Once & Always, which celebrates the 30th anniversary of the Power Rangers franchise and also marks her character's first appearance since her departure from the series in 1996, with the character Minh taking over the saber tooth tiger power.

Buy Photo Ops

Cam Clarke

Known For

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Akira, Metal Gear Solid

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $50 |

Photo Op: $50 |

Selfie: $30 |

Autograph/Selfie Combo: $70 |

Voice Recording/Phone Calls/Videos: $80 |

TMNT Photo Op (Barry Gordon, Townsend Coleman, Cam Clarke, and Rob Paulsen): $150

Cam Clarke is known for his work in animation and video games. Clarke is well known for providing the voices of Leonardo in the original Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles animated series and Shotaro Kaneda in the 1989 original English-dub of Akira. He also voices Liquid Snake in the Metal Gear video game series. He got his first voice acting roles in the animated shows Snorks and Robotech. Clarke is also known for his roles as Max Sterling and Lancer in the 1985 Robotech series, Rigadon in Around the World with Willy Fog, Dogtanian in Dogtanian and the Three Muskehounds, and Prince Adam and He-Man in the 2002 version of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe TV series.

Buy Photo Ops

Townsend Coleman

Known For

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, The Tick, Inspector Gadget

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $50 |

Photo Op: $50 |

Selfie: $30 |

Autograph/Selfie Combo: $70 |

Voice Recording/Phone Calls/Videos: $80 |

TMNT Photo Op (Barry Gordon, Townsend Coleman, Cam Clarke, and Rob Paulsen): $150

Townsend Coleman is known for his roles as Corporal Capeman in "Inspector Gadget", "The Tick", Michelangelo, Rat King, and Usagi Yojimbo on the original "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles", Waldo on "Where's Waldo?", Gobo, Architect, and Wrench on "Fraggle Rock", Scott/Teen Wolf on "Teen Wolf", Scratch on "Spacecats", Wayne Gretzky on "Prostars", Riot on "Jem and the Holograms", Dragonflyer on "Glofriends", Rewind on "Transformers", and Sentinel Prime on “Transformers: Animated”. Coleman has also been the voice behind numerous national TV ad campaigns for clients such as Home Depot, Kellogg's Frosted Flakes, Mattel Hot Wheels, Sunny Delight, Colgate, Jenny Craig, Blockbuster Video, Greyhound, AT&T, Eggo Waffles, Taco Bell and the voice of "Spot", the precocious red 7-Up dot... even a few "Keebler elves" and "Raid bugs".

Buy Photo Ops

Barry Gordon

Known For

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $50 |

Selfie: $30 |

Autograph/Selfie Combo: $70 |

Voice Recording/Phone Calls/Videos: $80 |

TMNT Photo Op (Barry Gordon, Townsend Coleman, Cam Clarke, and Rob Paulsen): $150

Barry became a fixture as a character actor in feature films and television, most prominently as a co-star on the hit series “The New Dick Van Dyke Show” and “Fish,” and as the lawyer Gary Rabinowitz, Carroll O’Connor’s nemesis on “Archie Bunker’s Place.” He has also recurred as Larry David’s Rabbi on HBO’s “Curb Your Enthusiasm.” His voice was heard for decades as the Nestle Quik Bunny and he originated the voice of Donatello on the television animated megahit, “Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.”

Buy Photo Ops

Wayne Knight

Known For

Seinfeld, Jurassic Park, Space Jam

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $60 |

Photo Op: $80

Wayne Elliot Knight is an actor and comedian. He is known for playing Newman in the TV sitcom Seinfeld and Officer Don Orville in 3rd Rock from the Sun. His other roles include Dennis Nedry in Jurassic Park, Stan Podolak in Space Jam, Al McWhiggin in Toy Story 2, Tantor in Tarzan, Dojo in Xiaolin Showdown, Zack Mallozzi in Rat Race, Mr. Blik in Catscratch, and Haskell Lutz in The Exes.

Buy Photo Ops

Rob Paulsen

Known For

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, The Animaniacs, Pinky and the Brain

APPEARING: Friday, Saturday, Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $50 |

Photo Op: $50 |

Selfie: $30 |

Autograph/Selfie Combo: $70 |

Voice Recording/Phone Calls/Videos: $80 |

TMNT Photo Op (Barry Gordon, Townsend Coleman, Cam Clarke, and Rob Paulsen): $150

“I’m getting paid to do what got me in trouble in the 7th grade,” jests Rob Paulsen, who is one of the most popular voices in animation and won a Daytime Emmy in 1999 as “Outstanding Performer in an Animated Program” for Pinky and the Brain (WB). Though nominated twice previously, the victory was especially sweet due to the most formidable competition ever – fellow nominees Louis Anderson, Ernest Borgnine, Dom DeLuise, and Jeffrey Tambor. In addition to his Emmy, Rob won back-to-back Annie Awards in 1997 and 1998. “I absolutely love what I do and thank my lucky stars for twenty five years of full time employment in this business,” he admits. Interestingly, in those twenty five years, Rob now has the unique opportunity to have gone full circle with the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles animated series; having voiced Raphael in the original show, he is now voicing Donatello in Nickelodeon’s much anticipated TMNT.

Buy Photo Ops

Ron Perlman

Known For

Hellboy, Sons of Anarchy, Teen Titans

APPEARING: Saturday and Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $60 |

Photo Op: $80 |

Funko Pop Autograph: $75

Ron Perlman has played the role of Vincent on the television series Beauty and the Beast (1987–1990), for which he won a Golden Globe Award, Hellboy in both Hellboy (2004) and its sequel Hellboy II:The Golden Army (2008), and Clay Morrow on Sons of Anarchy(2008–2013). Perlman is also known as a collaborator of Hellboy director Guillermo del Toro, having roles in the del Toro films Cronos (1993), Blade II (2002), and Pacific Rim (2013). He is also known for his voice-over work as the narrator of the post-apocalyptic game series Fallout, Clayface in the DC Animated Universe, Slade in Teen Titans, The Lich on Adventure Time, and the Stabbington brothers in Disney's Tangled (2010).

Buy Photo Ops

APPEARING: Saturday and Sunday |

AUTOGRAPHS: $80 |

Photo Op: $100

George Takei gained global recognition through his iconic portrayal of Hikaru Sulu, the helmsman of the starship Enterprise, in the renowned original TV series Star Trek. Beyond his celebrated role, Takei's journey spans six decades in the entertainment industry. From a childhood marked by his family's internment in Japanese American camps during World War II, Takei emerged as a prominent advocate for social justice, LGBTQ+ rights, and marriage equality in the United States. His influence extends beyond acting to encompass a powerful voice in realms ranging from politics to popular culture.
